pageContext.claim: “I have no problem with a mask at all.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump was a johnny-come-lately to the pro-mask movement. His months-long refusal to wear a mask in public helped to politicize mask-wearing as a conservative vs. liberal issue, when it should have been an apolitical public health guidance, according to experts. At one point, Trump called masks a "double-edged sword." Ford chairman Bill Ford specifically asked Trump to wear a mask while touring an auto plant, as the company was requiring for all persons. Trump refused and showed up in front of the cameras unmasked, saying, "I didn't want to give the press the pleasure of seeing it."
